    PermuTest Class

    PermuTest.Rd

    This is the abstract base class for permutation test objects. Note that it is not recommended to create objects of this class directly.

    Active bindings

    type

    The type of the test.

    method

    The method used.

    scoring

    The scoring system used.

    null_value

    The value of the parameter in the null hypothesis.

    alternative

    The alternative hypothesis.

    conf_level

    The confidence level of the interval.

    n_permu

    The number of permutations used.

    data

    The data.

    statistic

    The test statistic.

    p_value

    The p-value.

    estimate

    The estimated parameter.

    ci

    The confidence interval.

    Methods

    Public methods

    • PermuTest$new()

    • PermuTest$test()

    • PermuTest$print()

    • PermuTest$plot()

    Method new()

    Create a new PermuTest object. Note that it is not recommended to create objects of this class directly.

    Usage

    PermuTest$new(
  null_value = 0,
  alternative = c("two_sided", "less", "greater"),
  n_permu = 0L,
  conf_level = 0.95,
  scoring = c("none", "rank", "vw", "expon")
)

    Arguments

    null_value

    a number specifying the value of the parameter in the null hypothesis.

    alternative

    a character string specifying the alternative hypothesis.

    n_permu

    an integer specifying how many permutations should be used to construct the permutation distribution. If set to zero (default) then all permutations are used.

    conf_level

    a number specifying confidence level of the interval.

    scoring

    a character string specifying which scoring system to be used.

    Returns

    A PermuTest object.

    Method test()

    Perform test on data.

    Usage

    PermuTest$test(...)

    Arguments

    ...

    data.

    Returns

    The object itself (invisibly).

    Method print()

    Print the results of the test.

    Usage

    PermuTest$print(digits = getOption("digits"))

    Arguments

    digits

    an integer specifying the minimum number of significant digits to be printed in values.

    Returns

    The object itself (invisibly).

    Method plot()

    Plot histogram(s) of the permutation distribution. Note that it works only if the test's type is "permu".

    Usage

    PermuTest$plot(style = c("graphics", "ggplot2"), ...)

    Arguments

    style

    a character string specifying which package to be used.

    ...

    extra parameters passed to graphics::hist or ggplot2::stat_bin.

    Returns

    The object itself (invisibly).
